title: Speedrun Charity Awesome Games Done Quick 2026 Raised Over $2.4 Million For Cancer Research
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                              Every January since 2010,...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
    
              
          
                Every January since 2010, Games Done Quick has raised money for charity through their speedrunning marathon event Awesome Games Done Quick (AGDQ). Their 2026 marathon, held at the Wyndham Grand in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, has just wrapped up, and has raised a huge sum of money.In a post on the Reddit, one of the event's organizers has revealed that Awesome Games Done Quick 2026 has raised $2,443,414 for the Prevent Cancer Foundation, which focuses on early detection and prevention of cancer. In total, Games Done Quick has now donated over $28 million to the Foundation of the $59 million in total the streams have raised for charity.Some highlights of this year's schedule of speedruns included some incredible performance in Mario Kart World's Free Roam mode, as well as a relay run of Super Mario 64 where 70 players collected one star each. There's also an incredibly fast run of Hollow Knight: Silksong, a five minute Chrono Trigger run, and a particularly epic speedrun of Pokemon Emerald that is worth a watch.          You can check out the entire collection of runs on Reddit if you want to see some extremely impressive performances.The next major charity stream from Games Done Quick will be Summer Games Done Quick, which will be held July 5-11. Awesome Games Done Quick has also been confirmed for 2027, and will be held in Atlanta from January 3-9.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

title: These Were The Top 15 Most Popular Games In The US Last Week
description: By     Eddie Makuch   on January 12, 2026 at 12:50PM PST                                GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases...
body:
By 
    Eddie Makuch
   on January 12, 2026 at 12:50PM PST    
          
                  GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
                The numbers are inEach week, Circana analyst Mat Piscatella shares data that reveals the top 15 titles in the US ranked by total weekly active users across PS5, Xbox Series X|S, and Steam. The lists come from Circana's Player Engagement Tracker, and to be sure, this tracks weekly active users, not concurrent users.Which games were the most popular for the week that ended January 3? Fortnite ranked No. 1 on PlayStation and Xbox, with Arc Raiders securing the top spot on Steam.Read on to see all the most popular games below for the week that ended January 3, as shared by Piscatella.PS5 - 15: Rocket LeaguePS5 - 14: Apex LegendsPS5 - 13: The Outlast TrialsPS5 - 12: EA Sports College Football 26PS5 - 11: Battlefield 6PS5 - 10: WWE 2K25PS5 - 9: Marvel RivalsPS5 - 8: Arc RaidersPS5 - 7: Madden NFL 26PS5 - 6: MinecraftPS5 - 5: NBA 2K26PS5 - 4: RobloxPS5 - 3: GTA 5 RemasteredPS5 - 2: Call of Duty HQPS5 - 1: FortniteXbox - 15: Mortal Kombat 1Xbox - 14: Forza Horizon 5Xbox - 13: Apex LegendsXbox - 12: Marvel RivalsXbox - 11: Rainbow Six SiegeXbox - 10: Madden NFL 26Xbox - 9: Rocket LeagueXbox - 8: Battlefield 6Xbox - 7: Arc RaidersXbox - 6: NBA 2K26Xbox - 5: MinecraftXbox - 4: RobloxXbox - 3: GTA 5 RemasteredXbox - 2: Call of Duty HQXbox - 1: FortniteSteam - 15: Team Fortress 2Steam - 14: PeakSteam - 13: War Thunder: World of PlanesSteam - 12: DeadlockSteam - 11: Dota 2Steam - 10: Path of Exile 2Steam - 9: Baldur's Gate 3Steam - 8: MegabonkSteam - 7: WarframeSteam - 6: Rocket LeagueSteam - 5: Helldivers 2Steam - 4: Marvel RivalsSteam - 3: Battlefield 6Steam - 2: Counter-Strike 2Steam - 1: Arc Raiders

title: The Sims 4 Next Collab Is Seriously Bougie, But Will Cost You Nothing
description: GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.                                          The Sims is no stranger to...
body:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.
  
              
          
                The Sims is no stranger to collaborating with major fashion brands. Back in 2007, developer Maxis partnered up with H&M to bring dozens of real-life clothing items to The Sims 2. In more recent years, both Primark and Moschino have made their way into the series with The Sims 4 Stuff Packs. Now, the American brand Coach is headed to the game in the series' most luxurious collab yet.Starting on January 13, The Sims 4 players will gain access to The Coach Collection, a catalog of nine new items inspired by the "wearable staples" and "bold statement pieces" Coach is known for. The Create-A-Sim items coming include the company's Soho sneakers, a varsity jacket, and sleek skirt sets, while Build Mode will receive the heritage trunk and both Tabby and Brooklyn purses.A look at the upcoming Coach collaboration.In addition to these items, The Coach Collection comes with a new family available to move in via The Sims Gallery: The Carriage House. The press release described the family as "three friends chasing big dreams, big style, and a little bit of drama." The gallery will also feature a new room to place named the "In The Bag room," which appears to be a large walk-in closet that will allow Sims to show off their luxury handbags in style.In other The Sims news, developer Maxis recently released a statement assuring players that its "values are unchanged" following news that parent company EA is looking to sell itself to the Saudi Arabia's Public Investment Fund. The team also reiterated that it is committed to creating "single-player life simulation experiences" while also teasing upcoming The Sims experiences for PC, consoles, and mobile.
                                  
  
    Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
